android.gameengine.icadroids.objects

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.gameengine.icadroids.objects.GameObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MoveableGameObject

    public class GameObject
extends Object
    GameObject is a (not moving) object with a lot of useful methods in it. You can bind a sprite on it, activate alarms, get the size, position, etc. Don't forget to add the GameObject to the game with 'addGameObject'!
    Author:
    Bas van der Zandt

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean active
      When active is false, the object can be destroyed

    • Method Detail

      • intializeGameObject

        public final void intializeGameObject()
        Initialize resources.
        Parameters:
        ge - the GameEngine which the object is running on

      • intialize

        public void intialize()
        Called when the application starts.

      • update

        public void update()
        update is triggered every loop of the game

      • drawGameObject

        public void drawGameObject(Canvas canvas)
        Draw the GameObject on the screen
        Parameters:
        canvas - Android canvas

      • updatePlayerFramePosition

        protected void updatePlayerFramePosition()
        update position rectangle used for drawing the sprite on the right position with the right size on the screen. This rectangle is also used for collision detection between GameObjects.

      • setSprite

        public final void setSprite(String resourceName)
        Set a sprite for the GameObject. Note: Extremely small sprites don't work well with Collision Detection!
        Parameters:
        resourceName - The name of the resource in the /res/drawable folder without extension , so when your picture in the /res/drawable is named 'picture.jpg', this parameter should be 'picture' .

      • startAnimate

        public final void startAnimate(int frameWidth)
        Start animating the sprite
        Parameters:
        frameWidth - The width size of each frame

      • stopAnimate

        public final void stopAnimate()
        Stop animating the sprite

      • getX

        public final int getX()
        get the x position on the screen
        Returns:
        x position on the screen

      • getY

        public final int getY()
        Get the y position on the screen
        Returns:
        the y position on the screen

      • getCenterX

        public final float getCenterX()
        Get the center x of the GameObject
        Returns:
        the center x coordinate of the GameObject

      • getCenterY

        public final float getCenterY()
        Get the center y of the GameObject
        Returns:
        the center y coordinate of the GameObject

        Get the absolute x position of the GameObject
        Returns:
        the absolute x position

      • getFullY

        public final double getFullY()
        Get the absolute y position of the GameObject
        Returns:
        the absolute y position

      • setX

        public final void setX(double x)
        Set x position of the GameObject WARNING: Do NOT use this method to move the player or a lot of methods will behave incorectly.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position

      • setY

        public final void setY(double y)
        Set y position of GameObject WARNING: Do NOT use this method to move the player or a lot of methods will behave incorectly.
        Parameters:
        y - The y position

      • setPosition

        public final void setPosition(double x,
               double y)
        Set the position on the screen.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position
        y - The y position

      • getSprite

        public final AnimatedSprite getSprite()
        Get the sprite Object of the GameObject
        Returns:
        Sprite Object

      • getFrameWidth

        public final int getFrameWidth()
        Get the size of the size of the frame width. This wil standard be the sprite width.
        Returns:
        The width size of the frame

      • getFrameHeight

        public final int getFrameHeight()
        Get the size of the size of the frame height. This will standard be the sprite height.
        Returns:
        The height size of the frame

      • outsideWorld

        public void outsideWorld(boolean horizontal)
        Triggered when the GameObject moves outside of the world.
        Parameters:
        horizontal - is true when the object moves outside the left or right edge. False when it moves outside the top or bottom edge.

      • getPosition

        public final Rect getPosition()
        Get the sprite position as rectangle
        Returns:
        Rectangle with the current positon + size of the GameObject

      • setAnimationSpeed

        public final void setAnimationSpeed(int speed)
        The speed of the sprite animation.
        Parameters:
        speed - The number of game loops that must occur before the next frame, so higher speed is slower animation. 0 stops animation.

      • setFrameNumber

        public final void setFrameNumber(int number)
        Set the frame number of the sprite when animated.
        Parameters:
        number - The frame number, frame numbers start at 0

      • deleteThisGameObject

        public final void deleteThisGameObject()
        Delete the GameObject

      • setVisibility

        public final void setVisibility(boolean visible)
        Set the visibility of the GameOject. The GameObject will still exist.
        Parameters:
        visible - True for visible, false for invisible

      • setLayerPosition

        public final void setLayerPosition(float position)
        Sets the image at the specified position of the layer. This position can be any number between 0.0f and 1.0f.
        Parameters:
        position - The position value of the image, images with a higher value will be drawn in the background

      • jumpToStartPosition

        public void jumpToStartPosition()
        Jump to the object start position Note: this only works when a start position is set, this happens automatically when 'addGameObject' is called.

      • setStartPosition

        public void setStartPosition(int x,
                    int y)
        Set a (new) start position which the objects jumps to when using 'jumpToStartPosition()'.
        Parameters:
        x - The start X position
        y - The start Y position

      • alarmsActiveForThisObject

        public boolean alarmsActiveForThisObject()
        Used for correct garbage collection of the alarms (see the interface IAlarm) Don't call this method by yourself! If you want your own implementation, overide this method.
        Returns:
        If the alarm can still be active for this object

      • getAngle

        public final double getAngle(GameObject object)
        Use this function to get the angle between you and another object. For example: You can use this function to check if you approaching another object from the left or right.
        Parameters:
        object - an instance of another object to calculate the angle for.
        Returns:
        the angle of the object or 0 if the object is null.
